entry.def: A pluralist society is one in which many different groups and political parties are allowed to exist.

example.ex: ...an attempt to create a pluralist democracy.
example.tran: 建立一个多元化民主国家的尝试

means.word_mean: 1. a philosopher who believes that no single explanation can account for all the phenomena of nature
2. someone who believes that distinct ethnic or cultural or religious groups can exist together in society

auth_sentence.content: The following year a new, pluralist constitution was adopted and the very name of the country changed.

auth_sentence.content: Eventually, George was able to become what was known as a "pluralist": a clergyman who oversaw two churches and had two incomes.
